item.title: Welcome
item.description: Welcome to my website. It’s currently under construction, as websites often are.

item.title: Code
item.description: Software to survive in linux development Efficient replacements to the horrible linux man pages, like cheat and tldr A good terminal editor (nope, not nano) like emacs or vim or more recent alternatives like micro Insta-terminal access, via the embedded terminal in dolphin or the drop-down magic of yakuake Heavy use of bash aliases and scripts for automation Software I develop A video / image classification and description wrapper in python3 and tensorflow, which you can find in my github page

item.title: About
item.description: I am a computer scientist currently employed as a researcher at the Institute of Informatics and Telecommunications of the National Center for Scientific Research Demokritos. I am currently working on event detection from text and news sources, automatic summarization, big data and machine learning. You can get a pdf of my detailed cv here. Alternatively, you can check out a tl;dr version below. Education MSc in Signal and Information Processing and Learning from the Informatics and Telecommunications department of the National and Kapodistrian University of Athens.
